Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera in a small package!
Reviews.Author: mle991
Reviews.Content: ***NOTE (4/24/12):The charging port for this camera uses a micro usb port, so if you are on the go or in the car you can just charge up the camera in the car with your car charger for your phone. Hope this is useful information for everyone :)***This camera is straight out fantastic. I have been using it for about 2 and half weeks now and it takes really crisp and sharp pictures. Although sometimes the pictures don't come out great but that is to be expected. This camera looks exactly like the previous model the WX9, i think the only difference is the screen size and the better digital zoom on this camera (WX50). Outside in the sunlight this camera performs flawlessly and the shutter speed is really fast with very little shutter lag. If you use the regular auto mode it tends to be faster at taking a pic and processing it right away, but if your use the auto plus mode the pictures comes out better but it takes about 1-2 second to process but it is well worth it and it is fast to move to a next shot right away.I absolutely love the sweep panoramic feature, it is one of the main reasons that I wanted to get a sony cybershot camera and because I have previously owned the cybershot T70 camera which was fantastic as well. Another feature that I like is the background de-focus mode. It creates images that resembles a DSLR with the bokeh and blurred background. Although it is not perfect everytime but it is consistent meaning about 8-10 shots would be perfect with the blurred background and the other two shots would be blurred too much or too little or just in the wrong place. I used a DSLR as my main camera but when I travel or go out with friends I like to bring along a smaller camera for the convinence. I initially was going to buy the HX9V but that camera was a little too bulky for me although it is absolutely great at producing sharp images (I've actually used my friend's HX9V for 2 weeks so I do know what I am talking about).Aside from all the great features I will deffinitely buy this camera again or another sony cybershot, except for the lower end models because of their horrible shutter lag.I have also posted some sample pictures too if you want to check out how well it performs :D***UPDATE 4-18-12This camera has performed fantastically over the last few weeks. I want to mention that I experienced the lens being stuck twice. It's not like a lens error message thingy where the lens wont retract but it was like when I hit the power button the lens won't come out. Through my experience, I just pulled out the battery and reinsert it and the problem was solved. Like I said it only happened twice but I solved it the same way twice. This is why I get hesitant buying the cameras where the lens goes in and out.Another feature that I am really getting addicted to in this camera is the HDR filter and the TOY CAMERA filter. The HDR filter is really neat and it comes in handy if you want to get more details out of the picture where the lighting is dim or where there are a lot of shadows. There are THREE (3) sensitivity levels that you can adjust. For me I only like to use it on the low level because I find that medium and high is just a little too much for me. The low setting works great and it doesn't over power your images with the "HDR" effect which I know that most people aren't a fan of. Its just another way to get more out of your shot with the high dynamic range, but thats just me, i find it really handy.As for the TOY CAMERA effect, I use it sometimes but not very often unless I want to give my pictures a vignetting effect. Thats what the toy camera effect does, its just gives the picture a vignette which is pretty good looking in some photos but I wouldn't used it too much because it makes your picture a little bit on the darker side and you can lose some details. I prefer the sony's toy camera effect over canon's because it doesn't give that bluish greenish lomo color to the images. You also have different options for it such as NORMAL, COOL, WARM, GREEN, and MAGENTA hues that you can add to the effect. Also you can use these effect while recording video which is also a plus, just dont switch to video mode but instead just hit the record button while in normal shooting mode with the effect selected.My final thought of this camera is that this camera is really good, you just have to be creative and use it wisely. The camera itself is just a tool, it just helps express your creativity and capturing a still moment in time. Happy shooting everyone :D

Reviews.Title: If possible, go for the Sony WX150 instead
Reviews.Author: lindguini
Reviews.Content: PROS:  Small size, low light capability, special featuresCONS:  Lens wobble during video zooming, image noise above ISO 200I've been searching for a point-and-shoot camera that can rival my six year-old Fuji F30. The F30 set the standard for low noise, low-light photo quality in small-sensor cameras and its performance has been difficult to beat --and I've tried, and purchased, several cameras since the Fuji.  The Sony Exmor R sensor appears to be the low-light performer I've been looking for and so I purchased and tested both the Sony WX50 and the Sony WX150 for comparison.The specs for the Sony WX50 and WX150 are virtually identical except for the optical zoom range (5X Carl Zeiss lens vs 10X Sony G lens) and sensor size (16MP vs 18MP).  I fully expected the WX50 with its 5X lens and 16MP sensor to have a slight edge in image quality due to simpler optics and fewer megapixels in the Exmor R sensor.  What I discovered was exactly the opposite.I took several photos of the same low-light scene using each camera set to ISO 200, 400, 800, and 1600 in the widest angle setting (no zoom).  When reviewed at 1:1, the WX50 photos showed considerable noise at ISO 400 and above (800 and 1600 were nearly unacceptable) whereas the WX150 was extremely noise-free even at 800 (with 1600 being quite impressive).  The WX150's images were even slightly better than my trusty Fuji F30 --finally!  There was no comparison --the WX150 lens/sensor combination provides noticeably clearer, lower-noise images at high ISO than the WX50.  The WX150 has better shadow detail and clarity despite its longer zoom range (usually a compromise) and higher MP (higher MP sensors are usually noisier).However, I was most disappointed in the WX50's video results when using the optical zoom.  When zooming during video recording, the WX50 lens is very "loose" and wobbles side-to-side during zooming in and out.  The result is that the video image jitters left and right when you're watching any video sequence with zooming.  The WX150, on the other hand, is rock-stable during zooming (which should be more difficult with the longer 10X zoom) and indicates that the WX150 has a more robust lens mechanism than the smaller 5X zoom in the WX50.  Just to be sure I didn't have a sample defect, I purchased and tested a second WX50 camera and it had exactly the same lens wobble.  Very disappointing!Overall, the Sony WX50 is a good performer compared to similar cameras from Canon and Panasonic.  The Sony Exmor R sensor is an excellent low-light performer as advertised and finally gives me a reason to retire my trusty Fuji F30.  Whereas the WX50 takes very good photos and video, I have to rate the WX150 performance as excellent in comparison.  If you desire the lowest image noise at high ISO settings along with a stable lens during video zooming, then the big brother Sony WX150 is the way to go.  Yes, the WX150 is more expensive but to me the performance difference, including a longer optical zoom, is well worth it since we're still talking about cameras under $200 (edit 1/5/13:  at the time of this review, the WX50 was selling for $119 and the WX150 was $169 on Amazon. It looks like the WX150 price has recently gone as high as $228 due to demand).

Reviews.Title: Camera will not always power on
Reviews.Author: samboy
Reviews.Content: This camera has a showstopper issue:-Occasionally the camera will not turn on correctly.The green LED will light up, but the lens will not come out and there is no power to the LCD screen.The camera will not respond to any button (green LED remains lit) and one is forced to remove the battery and reinsert it to get the camera functioning again.I was able to consistently reproduce this issue (3 times) by attempting to power on the camera every day. Typically the issue would happen on the 2nd, 3rd or 4th day. If the camera does power on correctly, then it seems to keep doing so until you put it away for a while.The main reason for purchasing this camera was to have something on hand that you could quickly take photos with. If the camera doesn't power on correctly then your photo opportunity is probably gone by the time you "fix" the problem by reinserting the battery (along with the fact that the battery compartment doesn't look engineered with this amount of use mind).Given that two other reviewers have also encountered this problem; I would recommend that would be buyers hold off any purchase for now........I have sent my camera into Sony service and will update this review with any new findings...........Other than that, this small camera is really nice; takes great video and reasonable pictures for the couple of weeks I had the camera in my possession.Update 30-May-2012==================Sony repair center called 23-May-2012 and explained that they could not reproduce the problem. I let them know that they needed to leave it off for a day, turn it on etc and usually after 3-4 days they will see the issue. I expect that they turned it off/on a few times in a row; which if it works the first time will continue to work.Not sure why they called, since they did not apparently care about the extra information I gave them. The tracking number of the returned package shows that it left their facility on 23-May-2012; so they didn't even wait one day to try again. They don't seem too interested in understanding what may be a flaw with their product (hopefully something that a firmware upgrade can solve down the road). I'm willing to help them; but they don't seem too interested..........We now have the camera back again with no repair/investigation done. It worked the first and second day; but today again the camera hung when we powered it on. We haven't even taken any photos or video with it.I'll call Sony Repair center again and have it sent back a second time...... Obviously not a very satisfied Sony customer at the moment.Update 8-July-2012==================Another cycle with Sony repair center completed. Again, they sent the camera back to me unfixed with "problem not reproduced". I went through the same procedure and powered the camera on every day and on the 4th day, the power on hang issue was reproduced again. I took video footage for each day to demonstrate the issue with Sony.Sony service center is scheduled to call me next week to discuss the issue further.....We have had this camera since April and I starting to get very concerned that Sony is not serious in helping us with this fault....... It's really worthless to us if it cannot reliably power on; We can't get Sony to fix/acknowledge the issue; we can't return it now and we can't sell it so we may end up simply having to "write it off" and buy another brand.I'll update the thread with any further progress.Update 2-September-2012=======================We received the camera back from Sony repair center on 24-August-2012; this took much longer than the last two times we sent the camera in. So we were cautiously optimistic that Sony was looking into our problem a little more seriously and the DVD disc with HD video showing the issue probably helped convince them that we did have a problem (I guess they must be inundated with people going out of their way to send them goods that are working fine!).Anyway, they did replace the logic board in the camera and it has now powered on every time without an issue over the last several days. I'd be curious to know if the new logic board includes a new firmware, but I couldn't find anyway to check this out.Sony did eventually resolve the issue; primarily due to my persistence in sending back the camera multiple times. However it has taken around 4 months to get a working camera (now with 7 months warranty left). Other than that, it does look like a nice little compact camera!

Reviews.Title: Love love LOVE it!!
Reviews.Author: MizB
Reviews.Content: Just received today and put it to the test...Took some indoor photos in low lighting and photos came out great. Went outdoors and photos were even better! I took some videos and oh my can you say UHHMAZING! Hands down Sony did a remarkable job on this little point and shoot.  I would totally recommend this camera, I'm no pro when it comes to  photographing but my photos says otherwise :)

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: bigg ace "bigg ace"
Reviews.Content: I pretty much would only buy Cannon products when it came to cameras. However, I decided to sit down and compare specs this time. I replaced my last Cannon camera because I had it almost 8 years and it was time to upgrade. The main reason for my upgrade was that I had to hold the capture button about 3 full seconds before it would take the picture. I love this Sony camera. It takes the picture immediately after pressing the capture button. The video feature picks up sound well. But the best feature is it's ability to take pictures in the dark or at night. This flash has to be the brightess ever. My friends marvel at how well the night pictures come out. I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Batteries
Reviews.Author: Jairo
Reviews.Content: What I like the most about this camera is the low light capability, it's possible to take acceptable pictures with the WX50 in low light conditions.  However, little particles of dust can be seen through the lens making it neccesary to blow air into the camera to remove them to avoid pictures with little dots in them.Battery life is something to keep in mind with this camera: Altough many cameras can work a whole day with a single charge, this camera can't. It is mandatory to buy an extra battery to enjoy all the great features in this product.  Manufacturer is aware of this characteristic since they include in the box:"Remember a spare battery", which usually doesn't appear in the promotion logos.The excesive consumption of batteries can be caused by the increase in temperature during filming.Anyway, I like pictures taken with the DSC_WX50camera, good quality and useful features such as the 3D sweep panorama which usually would require several shots.Size: This camera is a bit small for regular sized hands but ths can be fixed by ussing the wrist strap supplied.Overall this is a good product that I would recommend to purchase, with an aditional battery, of course.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: J.L.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. When you are purchasing a point and shoot I think you need to be mindful of your expectations. Point and shoots aren't meant to be perfect cameras but a quality one should take nice pictures. This is my second Sony Cybershot with a Carl Zeiss lens. I absolutely recommend any Sony camera with this lens over any other! I have tried Olympus, Fujii, and other brands of cameras and I still go back to the Cybershot with Carl Zeiss.This specific camera is excellent in low light, bright light, action shots, and just about any other condition I have tried out. 95% of the time it autofocuses on the right part of the picture (which is great for the type of camera it is). The images are sharp, clear, and true to color. The intelligent auto setting works great.This camera is perfect for anyone who doesn't want to have to mess with settings. It easily uploads photos to your computer. There is a easy setting on the camera so you can have a very limited menu which I think is perfect for those who aren't tech savvy. And if you are tech savvy, you will be just as happy with this camera because there are many settings you can change if you'd like (though not necessary).Battery life: I have been using my camera just about every day now. I have taken thousands of photos with it. I am surprised by the battery life. I keep the camera on intelligent automatic, auto flash and my battery usually lasts about 2-3 days. If most of my pictures need a flash the battery does run out after about a day and a halfDurability: Unfortunately I dropped my camera about 3 feet and it hit a metal chair then hit the floor. I was so mad at myself and it was only the first week of use! I turned on the camera and there were no issues! Everything works just as always. There isn't even a scratch to be found.I honestly haven't found any negatives about this camera. If my opinion changes over time I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: B.A.Dunker
Reviews.Content: I was going to get the hx9v but saw this little cutie and chose it instead. I am not disappointed!  It takes great pictures with clarity and awesome color. I bought it to take pics if my (time of writing) 4 month son. Babies do not hold still and this camera catches all the special moments.

Reviews.Title: Great when working
Reviews.Author: Curtis Wade Tanner
Reviews.Content: The Good: The camera is very small and portable, easily fitting into a pocket or a small purse. Lots of great features and it is very easy to use. The photo quality was extremely good compared to my past cameras.The Bad: The camera worked flawlessly until the lens would no longer retract into the camera in less than a month's worth of use. Sent it off to be repaired (had to pay for shipping to service center).Was very excited for this camera until it stopped working. Hopefully it was just a problem with the camera I purchased and will have no further problems. Will update once I receive the camera back.

Reviews.Title: Traveler
Reviews.Author: Linda, Wisconsin USA
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this sturdy, compact camera. We just returned from a trip to Ireland and Finland and this camera took stunning landscapes, night views of the city from the plane,and bright, clear photos  both in and outside of people we met and places we visited. The panoramics were fun and the zoom is excellent. While the variety of settings took some time to figure out, they allowed for a remarkble amount of control in the type of picture we wanted to create. I took pictures of 400 year old headstones and read them on the computer when they could not be read by the naked eye. A fellow traveler lost an earring and I was able to take blind shots by sticking the camera under a cabinet and the auto focus helped locate it for her.  My only negative comment is that the camera seems to turn off quickly between shots and I think the turning off and on seems to take a bit more battery power than my previous Sony. This might be in a setting that I have not discovered. Anyway, I always carry extra batteries and I would suggest that you get some if you are planning for long days.

Reviews.Title: A slim, yet solid and very quick point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: dlc "dlc"
Reviews.Content: A few months ago I purchased a Cyber-shot WX150 on sale for $149 at the B&M; store with the bulls eye logo, and just recently I came across this WX50 on clearance for $47 at the very same store.The WX50 is very similar to the WX150, both use Sony's high-performance Exmor R BSI CMOS sensor for very fast performance with greater low light sensitivity. The WX50 is very responsive to turn on, with fast shot to shot times and virtually no shutter lag. I was able to take 10fps in burst mode although you will have to wait a few seconds for the camera to process the frames until your next shot.Photo quality has very good color and sharpness up to 8x10 prints, although as you increase the print size or zoom into the pixels the images do have a painted look to them. My Canon Powershots appear to do better in the detail and sharpness department as the image is enlarged.Like the WX150, the WX50 uses HDR High Dynamic Range technology which is awesome for a "point and shoot" camera. At one click of the shutter release button the camera quickly takes multiple exposures of a single scene at varying exposure levels to create one image with greater dynamic range. The camera also has an impressive array of scene modes and custom settings.Video is recorded at full 1080p with stereo sound, what is neat about this camera is that you can capture up to 10 still images as you are recording video, I've found myself using this feature very much. The WX50 also features a very entertaining slide show mode with 4 different styles that displays the photos and videos on the camera with built-in music and effects, very cool and impressive. Gone are the boring slide shows with 35mm Kodachrome and a projector! I use a mini HDMI adapter to plug the WX50 into my television's HDMI input that works great.The WX150 has a 10X optical zoom while the WX50 only has 5X, although I didn't find myself missing the extra focal length for my intended use with these cameras. In handling between the two Cyber-shots the WX50 is smaller with rounded edges and felt more durable than the WX150, the WX150 feels more plasticky and I would tend to treat it with more care.The WX150 is a very highly rated and fantastic camera, although in actual use I prefer the WX50 simply because it has a more solid feel to it while capturing equally impressive images.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: André Rocha Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me tell you I'm not an expert photographer or anything like it. I like a simple camera to take some decent photos, which is compact enough to fit in my pocket.This camera is pretty sleek, it is very light and compact, I do like the controls, the screen and the look and feel when operating it. It has many features, several scene presets and it's quite fast to point and shoot. However... this all falls apart from the moment I take the memory card and review the pictures on my computer. I've read so many good reviews about this camera and the pictures it produced, that I was completely shocked when I reviewed the pictures. To be quite honest, I get sharper images with my iPhone than this camera. It does a decent job focusing near by subjects, either people or monuments, but when you try to photograph a landscape it's misery. You first review the pictures and you think they're kind of neat, but once you zoom in to 100% they're useless. They're too softened, there's no sense of depth in the objects in there. I don't quite see the point of having 16MP if you can zoom in to see the details.I haven't even tried it a night, all the picture I took were in plain daylight so I can't rate it's capabilities in low light environments. Maybe this just wasn't the camera that suited my needs, maybe this just something you take with you to have a couple of pictures with your friends, but I did expected a whole lot more, specially after reading  the reviews all over the internet. The camera is currently being returned, I prefer to expend a few extra dollars and try a higher end camera that can produce sharp pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best ultra compact you can buy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my third Sony Cyber-shot, and every one has been impressive in terms of value, features, and performance.  There is almost nothing this camera can't do well for it's size.  The combination of the f2.6 Zeiss lens with the Exmor R CMOS sensor is great as it does exceptionally well in low lighting without the flash.  Video quality is also excellent, and Sony's superb image stabilization is almost like having a tripod or a steadycam.  This is also one of the only ultra compact cameras to feature stereo audio recording, which as a musician, is extremely helpful.  Plus, you get all of the cool Sony features like the original and still the best sweep panorama, background defocus (for a DSLR-like shallow depth of field),  and hand held twilight mode for extremely low light situations (I use this more than any other feature).  I've compared this with my older HX9v (replaced by the HX20 and HX30) and performance is very similar, although the WX50 is a bit faster at processing.  I'd say that unless you really need the extra zoom from the WX100 or 150 or the few extra features like WiFi or GPS on the HX20 or 30, the WX50 is perfect and an absolutely stunning value.

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera, BUT ...read this exchange with Sony Support
Reviews.Author: Terry Peterson
Reviews.Content: For one, this camera takes excellent pictures and works well in low-light conditions.  Video is very good, just shy of excellent for a point-and-shoot.  This was my wife's "new baby" present for when our second son was born this past April.As other reviewers have mentioned the camera seems unstable.  Will not power on at times, lens will not retract at times. I contacted Sony Support. Due to the conversation I had with Sony I will not be keeping this camera, which is unfortunate because it's feature-set is great.This chat occured with Sony Support on 7/19/2012You are chatting with Jess - ( C467 ).Sony Electronics7:47 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Hi. Welcome to Sony Online Support. I'm Jess.7:47 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  I understand that the camera is not turning ON. Is that correct ?-------------------------------------7:48 AM  Customer:  For the past week our camera would not power on, and the lens has been stuck out and open.-------------------------------------7:48 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Okay.7:48 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Are you using completely charged batteries with the camera ?-------------------------------------7:48 AM  Customer:  I'd tried with different USB cords to charge it... on computer and via wall-jack adapter.7:49 AM  Customer:  Just this morning, after more than 5 days of not being able to use it, the camera started responding while plugged into to USB-to-computer power.-------------------------------------7:49 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Okay.7:50 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  What was the message appearig on the camera ?-------------------------------------7:50 AM  Customer:  Now that it's powered on the message is "Writing to Memory card was incomplete"-------------------------------------7:51 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Okay.7:51 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Try power resetting the camera by removing the camera battery for a minute.-------------------------------------7:51 AM  Customer:  While plugged into power or not plugged in?-------------------------------------7:52 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  While the camera is unplugged from the power source.-------------------------------------7:53 AM  Customer:  Ok, I've pulled the battery and unplugged.-------------------------------------7:53 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Alright, kindly wait for a minute.-------------------------------------7:54 AM  Customer:  No problem... while we're waiting, do you know if a firmware upgrade is available on this model. From Amazon reviews it appears a number of customers experience instability in this model.-------------------------------------7:55 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Unfortunately, there are no updates mentioned for this model.7:55 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  There are no product issue alerts mentioned for this model of the camera.7:56 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Insert the battery into the camera now7:57 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Try turning ON the camera.-------------------------------------7:57 AM  Customer:  I'm not sure of your escalation channels, but I would strongly recommend having Sony look at the Amazon reviews to encourage a firmware upgrade or something. While the camera is working now, this has happened a couple times to us already in the months of owning it.7:57 AM  Customer:  It's powered on showing the same "Writing to memory card was not completed correctly. Recover data?"-------------------------------------7:58 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Unfortunately, we are not authorized to comment on the third party websites. However I thank you for the suggestion.7:58 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Okay.7:59 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  Can you access the menu items of the camera ?-------------------------------------8:01 AM  Customer:  Yes, now that the camera is powered on it appears to work okay. To clarify my suggestion, is not to comment on third party sites... but to review the sites to see what customers are experiencing (few customers actually take the time to seek support). I'll be returning this camera to Amazon for a Canon due to this exchange we've had... b/c Sony should be aware of these issues. This is the first Sony product I've been unhappy with the quality of.-------------------------------------8:02 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  I can understand you concern.8:02 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  However, if any issues are persisting kindly bring it to our notice, we will be glad to provide the information to resolve the issue-------------------------------------8:04 AM  Customer:  Thank you Jess, for the record I think you've done your job well here. As stated however, Sony dropped-the-ball in seeking out customer's experience with this model.-------------------------------------8:04 AM  Jess - ( C467 ):  I can understand your frustration.

Reviews.Title: this camera dissapointed me
Reviews.Author: Jorge Acuna
Reviews.Content: I have a DSLR camera that it works very well for me, but I needed a small good camera to carry with me, mainly to take pictures in indoors. I chose this camera because it has good comments and also is Sony brand.After I took my first picture I realized it camera wasn't what I expected. First, the screen doesn't have good colors and it shows pictures brighter than they really are.Also, the flash is too bright, I mean, in pictures, light colors tend to be a little burned. It is an issue for me because my intend is use this camera in indoor, so, most of the time the flash is need it. To compensate it, I need to use my edition software to balance colors.Something that I really like is the panorama mode, I've taken very nice pictures mainly outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Even for $100 there are better cameras
Reviews.Author: William H. Billings "islandhopper3"
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera.  It's gotten good reviews on photography websites, but my experience with it was surprisingly disappointing.  The first photos taken looked great using the image viewer.  So, I decided to use it for a friend's wedding anniversary party.  It didn't take long to find out about the camera's poor low light performance even using manual settings, and the short-comings of the zoom.  The worst part was the image distortion that made subjects look like they had been photographed using a fun-house mirror, i.e. long torso with short legs.  Maybe my camera was a lemon, but this is the second Sony P&S; I've tried that's had serious faults.  There are other sub-$100 cameras that will perform better than this one.  I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life, wish I had my old Canon back...
Reviews.Author: David J Kinzer
Reviews.Content: My sweet husband bought me this camera for Xmas 5 months ago, replacing my 7 (?) yr old Canon SD1000 point and shoot. I like to take spontaneous shots of the kids and while on trips.Good points: - it fits in my pocket (though it's no smaller than my old Canon).  - Several cool options for photo effects, like oil painting effect, Instagram look, etc.  -  I haven't had the lens problem that others have had.Bad: - AWFUL battery life. I have to take 3 batteries with me on trips, and sometimes go through all 3 in a day. This is  for several 1-2 minute videos and maybe 20 photos in a day. And the batteries don't hold a charge after recharging for more than a few days max...sometimes only a few hours. My Canon lasted days to weeks with a single battery.  - I agree that the resolution leaves a lot to be desired when reviewing. Too many blurry pics.  - I think I understand how to use this pretty well, but somehow it will randomly change to special effects without going through the menu.I wouldn't get this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Robbins "The Authority"
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Low light is good, not quite as good as I expected after reading reviews but still above average. Video is excellent. Pics look great. Minimal shutter lag.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Mick
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use, and has an extremely sharp/vivid picture. I love the motion and panoramic modes. Would highly recommend this compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark Berggren
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about this camera (purchased in April 2012), but my wife and I just took it out of the box and are blown away by what this camera can do!I was VERY concerned about its video capabilities, because I'm a mac user. I had read some reviews that said it used an out-dated video codec, so I was surprised to find out that it also has an MP4 option in the menu! Go Sony!!!!Amazing pictures. Amazing video. Amazing camera!

Reviews.Title: Second Sony-Cyber shot Camera
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX50 is a very fast, 5x zoom ultracompact with lots of automatic shooting options, and very good photo and video quality.Overall, the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX50 produces very good photos both indoors and out. Exmor R CMOS sensor is great in low light. This camera replaces my old Sony DSC-W220. The first thing I noticed was how much smaller it was compared to my old one. The smaller size allows it to easily fits in pocket/purse.Cons The case of the camera is made of all plastic, I like the feel of Aluminum much better.Recommend  buying 2.7" LCD  Optical Glass Screen Protector, if you look you can find one for a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: lobo
Reviews.Content: After comparing a lot of products, I settled with this camera. After using it for a couple of months, I'm really glad that I went with it. I think it's best my <$200 could buy. It has very good in low light; I have never had to use the flash at all!What I think is missing - it's just 5x zoom; I wish it was a little faster in clicking the pictures in auto mode. But, hey for $200 - I really can't complain. :-)Overall, I'd buy this again!

Reviews.Title: HUGE Upgrade.
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: I NEEDED to upgrade from my older Cyber-shot from two years ago, and this was probably the best purchase I've made in a while. The camera itself takes AMAZING pictures for a point-and-shoot. The background defocus effect works perfectly. The pictures in lower light are not amazing, sadly. It looks 10x better when the flash is on, and let me tell you, the flash on this thing is powerful. The video recording is freakin amazing as well. Of course, it looks 10x better outside than inside. If you're on a budget, this would be your best purchase, trust me. The camera takes pictures really fast, flash and without flash, as well. The face tracking on this thing is very powerful and fast. I had the camera far from my friends face, and it still tracked it from the  far distance.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and video recorder
Reviews.Author: skier
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Really easy to use and it takes excellent pictures.  The video on the camera is great.  It's nice to not have to bring a camera and separate video recorder to events.Other things I like:*excellent zoom*photos in poor lighting come out amazingly well*camera is really smallOnly one little comment, sometimes in darker environments, the auto focus unfocuses while video taping.  It did this at my daughter's band concert.  The sound is still good but the video comes in and out.  It was dark in the audience and I think that confuses the auto focus.

Reviews.Title: Good quality. Fast response.
Reviews.Author: Ansar F.
Reviews.Content: This camera is my 4th point and shoot over the past few years and my second Sony. Firstly, the camera design and feel is all good with fairly easy controls and very lightweight yet solid. Compared to other cameras this took pics much faster (less delay) with highest resolution settings. It seems to constantly be auto adjusting the focus when On, which may be helping it respond faster which was great for catching moments. Resolution at zoom was pretty good as well. It uses a micro USB cable for charging which is quite convenient with most phones,etc already using the same.Dislikes: This may be simply an adjustment, but using auto mode the flash was too bright sometimes. While the image defocus feature (SLR style pics) looked excellent and professional, it didn't always work accurately. Again these were auto settings.Overall this was an excellent buy for the price and would recommend this for someone looking for an easy to use start and snap camera who doesn't care for too many customizations or settings.

Reviews.Title: Huge fan!
Reviews.Author: A.Stella
Reviews.Content: It takes me forever to buy things like this, trying to decide in a sea of cameras is hard- do I really need those features, will I use them, is it worth the price etc.  But I am so incredibly glad I got this one!Out of everything the thing about this that I like the best is how great the camera is in low light situations, at night, at concerts, at dusk.  Its amazing!  I've never gotten such great concert shots from this type of camera, usually the lights from the stage ruin everything but not with this one.I also like that it knows which advanced mode will best suit the situation you are in, so if you dont want to pick for yourself it will do it for you.  Although you still have the option to make your own choices and there are a number of filters that you can apply too, like water color, or black and white which can be fun to play with.It also has a pet feature which I am completely excited about- I have for the first time been able to get pictures of my small furry black dog that looks like she has a face!  Usually she looks like a black blob and we just know that she is there, but this got her whole face with great detail.I also enjoy that it keeps track of the date that the photos were taken for me, but not as an imprint on the photo but as a very simple file name on the card- I can be a little OCD when I do photo albums and I like to keep things in order on vacation so this helps me remember.I didnt like that the camera didnt come with a case, but that was easily fixed and it didnt bother me enough to make me dislike the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely 5/5; perfect camera; total value for money
Reviews.Author: RG
Reviews.Content: This camera was a phenomenal purchase. One of the best gadgets I've ever bought. It takes perfect pictures; has great in-camera features (isolating colors; blurring some parts of the photo; burst mode; pop color mode etc) that give you a lot of options to tinker with your photography; battery life is awesome; its very compact (I bought it so that I could leave my SLR at home since it's bulky to carry for daily photographic needs); and it looks great. It also accepts a generic SD card so you're not stuck with Sony's proprietary memory card format. I considered a LOT of other cameras before I bought this one but I'm super glad I got this one. Its priced VERY competitively, and does a great job of being a very good camera. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: Ok...shakes a lot
Reviews.Author: Kamalp5
Reviews.Content: Camera was ok but, the pictures seem to be shaken...unless held very steady, if you move even slightly, the pictures show up blurry and shaken...

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Ram
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera two years back and I am still finding pretty good. I would recommend this camera if you are looking for following features,Size vs Zoom : I was looking for a small cam which can fit into my pocket but it should have a descent zoom. This one had both the options. There were few others, which had higher zoom than this one but other features made it winner for me.Easy to operate : I gifted this camera to my parents and I wanted something which has all the cool feature but not very complex for them to use. It has intelligent photo mode and auto focus, which provides you very good picture quality.Screen size and type: This one has pretty descent screen size. At one time I was more interested in touch screen but then later I realized that touch screen in not easy to use always. It makes it difficult to operate in sun light and kids cant handle it either.Extra feature: This was the first camera with sweet panorama, which I found very useful. Its low light mode is very effective and picture quality is one of the best in class (don't compare it with high end DSLR). I have compared its picture with many other cams and found it very impressive.So if you are looking for a small camera, which isn't very complex to operate but still has lots of features then this is the best option.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful pictures with quality!
Reviews.Author: Rambo
Reviews.Content: Finally, a new camera to replace my old point and shoot that has been defective. For more than a year, my old Sony digital camera has failed to work. But with cellphones taking nearly as good pictures, I was too slow to buy a new standalone digital camera. I knew I wanted something beyond the built-in camera in my cellphone (my phone, a Sony Xperia, takes fairly good pictures). I wanted an actual digital camera for better pictures to take during special occasions such as vacation with my girlfriend or friend's parties I attended. This unit comes with 16.2 megapixels, making the pictures taken really clear. Think of it as HD television. The camera is small and can easily fit in a pocket, although I separately purchased a bag for it. This is a good unit for a family camera and for casual use. I didn't give it a five-star rating because to my surprise, there is a delay in each picture taken. The camera takes about three seconds to process every single picture you take, something I wasn't used to. I don't think all cameras have that type of delay. But it is a minor inconvenience to me as my phone can already take rapid succession, back to back pictures.

Reviews.Title: A decent camera
Reviews.Author: Running mom
Reviews.Content: This is a 16.2 mega-pixel camera with 5x optical zoom.  It also has video, panoramic photo capabilities, a timer, and a continuous photo option.  We were looking for something to replace our Nikon point and shoot that just broke.  The Sony Cyber-shot is a good middle of the line point and shoot camera.  Pros:  It takes good quality photos and is simple to learn to use.  Although, the manual that came with the camera left a lot of necessary information out.  After an online search, I was able to find a full manual for this camera that was much more helpful.  Cons:  The processing time (from the time you take the picture until it is ready to take another one) is quite lengthy.  It doesn't come with an SD card so be prepared to purchase that also.  Overall, a decent camera, just wished it operated a little faster.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot for the price!
Reviews.Author: T. Tom
Reviews.Content: This camera's performance compares to other cameras costing three times as much! The Zeiss lens is tops and the HD video quality is just great. I've done direct comparisons between this camera and an equivalent Canon PowerShot model and this Sony does perform much better so I'm impressed!

Reviews.Title: Flash WAY too bright and over exposed
Reviews.Author: Shoppoholic
Reviews.Content: For the most part, I love this little camera for shots when I don't need flash,but when I do, every image is washed out bright, it really ruins pics. I wish Sony would adjust this in the auto intelligent mode!  I am now shopping for another camera and I have only had this one for a year.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: christine
Reviews.Content: It's really awesome, lots of features and very very quick! a favorite feature of mine is the rapid shutter 3 or 10 photos and also the beautiful skin filter because it makes faces look flawless!

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Knit Sith
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera to have around, It takes clean shots and has some photo editing built right in. Really fun to play with the artistic settings while take shots of the kids playing. Turns even just a cute candid into something a little more special.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: greg curtis
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to have in your pocket. And the quality is great from such a little machine...

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for the Price and has many features
Reviews.Author: Jore
Reviews.Content: I initially purchased a Nikon Coolpix S9050 but returned it for this Sony cybershot. Takes awesome pictures in "auto" mode, which is what most people will use anyway. It has many different scenic options as well. Has the capability of taking 3D pictures (haven't tried that yet). It shoots 1080 HD video which is a great option to have. Shoots great in low light conditions compared to the Nikon. It is very compact compared to the Nikon. All the menus are easy to get to and very straightfoward. Another awesome feature I like is it can detect Eye-Fi cards. It has an icon on the screen when the card is transmitting.All in all.....awesome buy and can probably be compared to more expensive point and shooters. Wanted something I can point and shoot quickly without having to mess with settings. This is a sidekick to my Canon DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Wow was worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Marques Gomez
Reviews.Content: So glad I purchased this! My family loves it and so do I!HD works perfect and it's very compact, the perfect size.Detail on camera is appreciated as well.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Claudio
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a bit concerned about the lens issues. However, I decided to give it a try. I have it for 2 months now and love it.Pros:HD recording (awesome);Zoom while recording;Small size;Cons:If you zoom a picture after it was taken, it does looks blurry (like a painting);In my opinion, it's the best point and shoot type of camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed
Reviews.Author: marrngtn
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera last month and just got around to using it.Decided to take it on an outing to NYC for a client, needed to be able to produce some video to go along with my pictures from my DSLR.The DSLR didn't make it out of the bag.  Started using this camera from the limo pickup at Penn Station to the end of the tour at the 9/11 Memorial.  The pictures were sharp and crisp.The camera produced very good images and with all of the walking we did in the financial district the size of the unit was a pure joy.Havent had time to tinker with the modes too much but I can tell you the panoramic mode is .........wait for it..........AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!This little one is going to be a strategic weapon added to the arsenal.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-WX50
Reviews.Author: snoepe
Reviews.Content: Bought the Sony WX50 after researching for a long time all the different cameras available and decided that this Sony was the best deal for the money.So far it has lived up to my expectations and I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera Sony
Reviews.Author: George J. Carroll "Author"
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all aspects. Takes beautiful pictures and am very pleased with this purchase as it lived up to all expectations.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best money I've ever spent on a camera. It takes crisp pictures and it's really easy to use. It has a lot of cool options that I will probably never use, but it's always fun to know they're there.This also takes awesome videos. You can shoot in HD and get a really great quailty video. I use this to shoot youtube videos, so it does the job I need it to do. I highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Dollar!!
Reviews.Author: Eve
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! It stands to prove that you really don't need those big bulky cameras just to capture the moment--everywhere I go, I can just grab it out of my bag if the moment arises with no trouble at all. This camera has many great features to choose from and even better, it takes excellent night time pictures. Completely satisfied with my purchase! Note: comes with charger and wrist strap; don't forget to buy a memory card!

Reviews.Title: Enjoying this little camera more and more as I use it!
Reviews.Author: dj
Reviews.Content: Looking to replace my 5-year old W150 with a new pocket camera, I tried this camera along with a Panasonic Lumix SZ7 and a Nikon Coolpix S6300. This one won out for the accuracy of the colors and consistency of the zoomed-in detail of the pictures, even in low light. It is a sturdy little camera with satisfying heft, moves fairly quickly from shot to shot, and is just right for using at a moment's notice. Sony's in-camera guide is an added benefit.

Reviews.Title: Playback button powers camera ON, wastes battery in your pocket
Reviews.Author: Patti Viri
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for the size, it's perfect to take travelling as it fits in my pocket. However, the camera turns ON when you hit the playback button, which is on the back in the lower right corner, and SUPER ACCESSIBLE. When you hit it twice, it puts the camera into shooting mode and actually makes the lens pop out. This is super annoying when it's in your pocket or purse and your camera keeps turning on all on its own.I really wish Sony had kept the on/off button for the purpose of turning the camera on and off and NOT have other buttons turn the camera on. What a waste of battery. I'm now afraid to bring it anywhere as when I actually want to use it the battery is dead because it has been sitting on in my pocket.This camera was almost perfect, as the pictures and functions are great, but what an awful design flaw.I really hope Sony issues a firmware update of some sort that allows you to disable that button from turning the camera on. That would be great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome video, decent pictures, but poor battery life
Reviews.Author: SLD93 "SLD"
Reviews.Content: This was actually an impulse purchase at a Big Box store, on the eve of a Saturday trip to the Penn Relays. I'll consider buying an additional battery for it, but am leaning toward returning it.  Bottom line, the battery life was much poorer than I had anticipated, and I don't think there's much I can do short of dragging around spare batteries.I already have, and am thrilled with, a Sony DSC-H70 and a spare battery which I purchased on this site.  Unfortunately, it's not pocket friendly. The new DSC-WX50 looked like a more portable equivalent (16mp and 10x zoom), with the added benefit of Full HD 1080 video.I didn't anticipate that the WX50's battery life would be this poor.  I calculated that the battery life equated to 13 Full HD videos averaging about 4 minutes each, plus 20 still pictures and 2 panorama shots.  That's 22 pics and less than 1 hour of HD video, total.  Sorry, that's just not good enough, unless you're dragging a bag of batteries around.  My DSC-H70 more than doubled that output on a single charge, and recently survived an all-day track meet on a single battery.Full HD 1080/60i movies with the DSC-WX50 were consistently stunning, and superior to the 720p movies I took on the same date, under the same conditions, with my DSC-H70.  If I do keep the DSC-WX50, it'll be for the movie quality. The WH50 gave incredible detail of each runner at the opposite end of the stadium, with almost no visible camera shake.  The action from that distance wasn't as clear with the H70.Pictures were better on the DSC-H70.  The DSC-WX50's pictures were good at first glance.  But when loaded and viewed on a large monitor, they were disappointingly fuzzy on faraway details, both in smart/intelligent/auto mode and in landscape mode. My guess is that the H70's G-series lens is superior, because the detail is better with the H70.

Reviews.Title: I had hoped for better
Reviews.Author: T. OBrien
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for a trip I recently went on. The size was a big plus, since I can fit it in a small cell phone pouch on my belt. Being easy to carry is a big thing if you want to have the camera with you when the opportunity to take pictures presents itself!I noticed sometimes the pictures are really clean, particularly when there's a lot of contrast between one thing and another. Where it goes bad, is when there's NOT so much contrast. For instance, a photo of the interior of a car showed a light up display crystal-clear. However, another photo taken outside in bright light looks like an oil painting when viewed at its native resolution.That's my main complaint on this camera, that "oil painting" effect when viewed at 1:1 resolution. I believe it's the image compression software that creats the .jpg files causing the problem, but there's no adjustment for that in the settings. I understand this small camera won't provide DSLR level performance, but with 4 and 5 megabyte picture files, a Zeiss branded lens, and a 16MP sensor, I really expected more detail and less "oil painting".If I can figure out how to upload a few photos, I'll add some examples to support what I'm saying.

Reviews.Title: Not happy!
Reviews.Author: francis x. rurka IV
Reviews.Content: The camera's 'ON' and 'Playback' buttons are way to easy to press. So much so that you'll find it turned on in your pocket or purse. Mine recently broke when I stored it in a small purse and I had unknowingly pushed the 'ON' button, the lens popped out, and I later found it bent and heard small pieces of the camera jiggling around.  Camera pictures were okay. I did love the panoramic feature and it had very good video quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but stopped working after a month of use
Reviews.Author: Silvio
Reviews.Content: The camera was good while it lasted (a little more than a month of use). After that the camera did not power on anymore.Sony warranty for products bought in US does not cover Brazil, which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: dingotech@earthlink.net
Reviews.Content: I bought this model to replace an older Sony point and shoot that I've used for a few years.  I was very disappointed in the WX50.  The photo quality was inconsistent--some dark, some blown out, some just right--and the videos were horrible.  It shoots 1080p (yay!) at 60i (boo!).  It's the "i" that disappointed me most, as any movement reveals that the video is interlaced.  I saw no way to change the settings to 30p, so now I'm left to deinterlace my videos in iMovie.  I returned it to Amazon and instead purchased a Canon 110 HS which has provided me with very consistent and predictable  performance.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from the Sony Cyber Shot WX50.

Reviews.Title: Awesome... at least for a cassual photographer
Reviews.Author: Erika
Reviews.Content: This is a low cost camera, we don't have to expect the best system ever... but the camera takes really nice pictures and works actually good... i would really recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera... Very impressed with the quality. This is everything I was looking for in a camera. Easy to use, very compact, excellent design

Reviews.Title: eh...not bad but not thrilled
Reviews.Author: M. Rotenberg "FunMark21"
Reviews.Content: I got this before i went on a baseball road trip with my buddies which we do every year and it had been a solid 8 years since I bought my last digital camera so it was time.  It's a good camera.  Pictures come out super crisp, and its small so I can throw it in my pocket without much worry.  My big problem is night photos come out pretty bad due to the flash being way to powerful.  Anytime I take a night photo of people they all come out white, or i turn the flash off and everyone comes out yellow looking since it is trying to pick up the light. Even of whole groups from above the flash is just way to powerful.  No middle ground.  I used to get so excited taking pictures with my old camera and was upset when it broke.  I can't say I'm as thrilled with this one and after one big trip...I might be getting another or just sticking with the iphone.  For day pictures though it works great.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Sony camera
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Hefley "PasoFinoRancher"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased only Sony cameras for years. This is the very best! A true pocket camera and the quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: jansci
Reviews.Content: After lugging around a DSLR for years, was finally persuaded that I needed a compact camera to capture unplanned moments with our toddler. This camera is so small that I sometimes forget that its in my pocket. Images are ok for use on Facebook or Picasa but are really washed out under florescent or indoor lighting.Pros:Really easy to use, just put it in one of the intelligent modes and off you goReally light and smallSurprisingly, the battery lasts more than 200 shotsPretty fast and pretty blur-free action shotsThe panorama mode was really cool, especially when shooting landscapesCons:Low-light images (even with flash) are really washed outThere is no way to control the flashImages may appear overexposed on the LCD screen, but actually looked accurate when viewed on the monitorImage processing is a bit slower than what I'm used to, but to compensate I just put it in burst-mode most of the timeEdit:Had to knock off one more star...there is a lot of details lost in the images, and there seems to be no way of turning off compression or noise reduction.

Reviews.Title: it's smart VS Cheaper price
Reviews.Author: Felemban,Ahmed
Reviews.Content: It's small like size credit card. It's smart, and it has a nice zoom. It has one problem about take a picture in night. the photo isn't clear. the price is cheaper for me

Reviews.Title: Screen Went in 1 year
Reviews.Author: Maria Vigliucci
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera, especially the soft skin feature.  Then, without warning, the screen had a big grey square right in the middle.  Took a picture, turned the camera off, and 5 minutes later went to take another picture, and the screen became defective... could only partially view the photos taken due to the grey square.  I didnt drop it or agitate it in any way to cause the issue.  Called Sony, and the camera was 10 DAYS outside the 1 year warrenty, and they refused to fix it unless I paid $90... the camera itself cost around $100.  Poor quality, poor customer service, I will stick to Samsung products.  Its a shame Sony does not stand behind their products.

Reviews.Title: Would like one that took less time to focus
Reviews.Author: Sandie "Sandy"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, takes good photos but it takes time to focus properly for better photos. I just want a camera that is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: When it works it takes fine pictures
Reviews.Author: jimmiehov "Jim1Jim1"
Reviews.Content: Operations: I have had this camera for year now and it is the best for me for the money, better quality and speed than my previous 'pocket' cameras.  That is except for the slanting inward at the tops of my pictures.  But all of my Sony's have done this.Mostly I use it with the "Easy Mode" which makes everything automatic.  The menu is a mess for me since I haven't learned it.  I am sure the advanced settings would be nice but I don't have time nor the need for this.  For sure in this mode it will not take nice pictures of the moon like my very old Kodak would.Problems. (1) Once in a while the lens will not retract.  Pulling the battery and replacing it fixes this.  Other times it won't go out.(2) Every time I have deleted photos using my computer the camera has troubles sorting an lining them up.  Most times I have to pull the battery to get it out of the 'assessing' mode.(3) The On/Off button is very sensitive and it comes on in my pocket.  Unless I hear the energizing noise tone it invariably leaves me with a dead battery.(4) The View Photo's button is even more sensitive and often the screen is on for long times, enough again to run down the battery.(5) Battery life is shorter for this camera than for my previous Sony's  I do not have a second battery but if missing a picture would cost you money then you should have two batteries, one all charged up and ready.(6) The case is all plastic and has warped to leave gaps.  I am tempted to glue it shut for more water proofing.  My last two Sony pocket cameras had tape holding buttons on or things shut, this one with the plastic case is worse still.  My daughter has a WX-150 and hers also has the gapping case warping problem as well as a friend having warping problems with his, either a WX-100 or a WX-180.(7) Every now and then it changes modes for no apparent reason. For me this means lost time figuring out what happened and then how to get it back to where I had left it.So far at then end of a year I have taken 4613 pictures with it.  So far so good.  Both my first Kodak and my first Kodak went over 10,000 pictures.  The Kodak was still working fine until it got killed by my beagle dog knocking it on the tile floor. The Sony lost some necessary buttons that I hadn't taped down.  The 'wheel' switch is the worst, I am ready to tape this one also although it is plastic and might be anchored differently.I did have some problems ordering this camera as it came from a vendor instead of Amazon.  I knew this but Amazon has had to collect sales taxes for Texas residents and their vendor did not.  But the vendor 'sat on' my order for more than a week before it was shipped.  Amazon itself is very fast..

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: EZ Biker
Reviews.Content: I know, smart phone cameras are the thing now; but I don't use a smart phone! The date and panorama features on this camera ROCK! Great photos and durable camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. We have it for more than a year now and it takes great pictures. If you are looking for a compact point and shoot camera, we cannot go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: bought mine a year ago, needed a small pocket sized camera, paid $37 bucks for it at Sam's club
Reviews.Author: J. Sanderson "JackRealtor"
Reviews.Content: was a display model w/no charger cord. Worth every penny, I love the quick shooting and small size. Recommend it as a small camera replacement for a larger SLR type digital I use for real estate work.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. It worked better than my moms Cannon and Fugi. The pictures were clear, and the zooming was awesome. It held its charge. The different scene options worked great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Juan Santamaria
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother. She is not a technology fan, however now she is into her new camera. She takes it everywhere and has easily learned to take nice pics. The resolution is awesome, the image quality is impressive. All the features are excellent. Sony is just the best!

Reviews.Title: Better than Cannon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Alexis Leonard
Reviews.Content: Love this point and shoot- small enough to fit in my pocket and my husband is willing to carry it in his when I don't have one.  Great lens- Carl Zeiss.  I have small children and my camera phone just isn't sharp enough for pictures with fast-moving subjects.  This camera satisfies my needs.

Reviews.Title: It's ok but glitchy
Reviews.Author: A "Reader"
Reviews.Content: This camera has focus problems, and it has issues reading the memory card more often than it should. My friend has the same camera and she's also had the problem where it will not read your memory card & claims you have no pictures (giving you a heart attack if you've been on vacation for weeks) until you plug it in your computer and realize your pics are all there.  I was surprised how bad the focus was on a lot of pics when I came back from vacation and viewed the pics on my computer.  The blurriness of the pics is harder to see on the small screen.  Also, there are a few modes - like intelligent auto, etc...and one of them is extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Schmoorbe
Reviews.Content: I've loved our Sony Cyber-shot. It's small enough to fit comfortably in my jeans pocket, is easy to use, and takes great pictures in low-light without a flash (on the "ISO" setting). My husband is in the SLR camp and has a hard time understanding why I would choose anything "less." But I will tell you confidently that this little guy "captures the moment" with beautiful pictures, and is a great camera for this mom on the go.My previous camera was a Cannon SX260HS. While it may have higher ratings on many sites, I found that it was slow, could not "capture the moments" with kids in low-light, and often gave an unwanted barrel-effect (with cone-heads at the periphery of my images).

Reviews.Title: One of the best purchases I've ever made period...
Reviews.Author: CHRISTOPHER J. SMITH
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that I am very pleased with my purchase of the camera and it works perfectly for me. I carry it with me wherever I go and have taken a ton of great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Price
Reviews.Author: BikingBerk
Reviews.Content: Small. Light. Durable. long lasting battery. charges off phone chargers cable. great photos everytime. easy to use. great on the fly editing system. Hurst me to say all this i hate sony but i really cant say one thing bad with it. sorry

Reviews.Title: Great camara
Reviews.Author: Martha
Reviews.Content: This camara was suggested to me and now I recommended to everyone - I love it - its easy to use and the photos are perfect.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Richard Rios
Reviews.Content: Had higher performance expectations. Glad my Coolpix 6000 still works.Battery life varies. Colors can be bright at times, but some stills have white-out. Video is great, but don't like file saving names. Video shots are NOT saved in sequential order with still shots. Play Memories software can be quirky at times. Will stay with Nikon Brand.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Juliet
Reviews.Content: This camera has many features that you would find in an expensive camera but at a reasonable price!  Would definitely recommend for a novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great P&S; camera for the price, though a little outdated
Reviews.Author: Don't Track Me "Aspiring..."
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for somebody who just wanted a camera that worked.  I ended up asking her to send me a lot of the pictures she took because they were better than the ones I took with my micro 4/3.Pros:GREAT internal intelligence:  There is a mode where you can hold down the shutter and it will take multiple photos and merge together the best qualities of each one.  There are a few smartphone camera apps that "do this", but this camera actually does it well.Some creative freedom:  Don't get me wrong, this is no DSLR, but if you look in the manual, it actually teaches you how to position yourself and your subject to get common photographic effects.  The camera usually recognizes what you are trying to do, and adjusts the aperture, shutter speed, etc. accordingly.Cons:This is already becoming an older camera. (if the pictures are good, who cares?)Would have been nice to have more functions, as well as the control of program, aperature priority, and shutter priority modes for people who know what they are doing.  But like I said, I was surprised at how intelligently the camera handled it.

Reviews.Title: Smaller than expected but SUPERB photo quality
Reviews.Author: RetAF
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use.  I've used it on a tripod and free-hand...picture quality is equal because the Sony Cyber-shot has a photo stabilization feature.  I REALLY like the USB photo transfer capability.

Reviews.Title: Husband loves this camera!
Reviews.Author: Diana C. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: My husband really loves this camera!  He's had it for 3 months now and it has been great!  Easy to use and takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: LOVE it....great video and pretty good shots, especially outside
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera to Mexico for a trip to the Yucatan.  It is SO tiny and portable. Got fantastic video clips of all the sights I wanted to see.  Was particularly good for outside pictures.  Inside, with low lighting, you really need to play with the settings to get shots that aren't grainy.  For the price, this camera is fantastic for video and pictures (most especially ones outside in natural light). The portability if simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures, But!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Calhoun
Reviews.Content: Takes terrific pictures, no matter what the weather conditions are like or how much light is on the subject.  But the battery does not hold out for a long day's photography and it will fail you just as you find the shot of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Polly Beattie
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. It has various modes and features. Great little camera with professional quality ^_^ Now I take way too many picture!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Hartmut H Franz
Reviews.Content: Bought for my wife she really liked it takes very beautiful pictures . Price is great.Why buy an expensive camera

Reviews.Title: very nice camera for price
Reviews.Author: OttoWolf
Reviews.Content: best point and shoot camera i have ever owned, tons a features and very good picture quality i would recommend it to anyone looking for a small and affordable camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Corey Niven
Reviews.Content: It's a great compact point and shoot camera.  It takes amazing pictures and is packed with features.  Only complaint is it doesn't have a touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, impressive video
Reviews.Author: Edge
Reviews.Content: I'm no photographer and prefer my cameras easy to use. On the other hand I'm a tech geek who appreciates quality images and video. I bought this to take excellent pictures with video being an after thought. I was surprised to see the video was actually really good. I also have a Panasonic HDC-TM700K camcorder ($1000 in 2010) which takes 1080p 60fps video. Both use the H.264/MPEG-4 AVC codec with the Sony generating MTS files and the Panasonic M2TS files. While the Panasonic generates the better quality video, the Sony was impressively close for the price. For non-important events, I leave the Panasonic home and just bring the WX50. While smartphone cameras have come a long way, they are still a ways off from dedicated digital cameras such as this model. The startup time and shutter speed was a huge reason I went with the WX50. Trying to quickly catch candid pictures of babies/toddlers can be an exercise in frustration and the WX50 gets big bonus points for its speed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Paige
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I had a crappy $40 camera I bought from a drug store and wanted a nicer one for my semester abroad.  It takes excellent pictures, even at night with the flash off.  Sometimes it is a little confusing to use and there is a bit of learning curve.  Just play with it a little and you will get the hang of it.  There's a nifty feature where it takes a bunch of pictures in a row really quickly and it compiles them to give you the best image.  Probably the best non-professional grade camera you will find for the price.  It is really tiny and easy to fit in a purse or even a larger pocket.  I advise you to put the wrist strap on it because its size makes it easy to drop.  Pretty good battery life too.

Reviews.Title: Good camera at a good price.
Reviews.Author: matthew weiss
Reviews.Content: Has worked great as a point and shoot for the last month. Haven't tried any of the more sophisticated features but basic pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Love it...no regrets
Reviews.Author: LiveLife
Reviews.Content: I chose this for the mp rating and I have been completely satisfied. The pictures are great quality. It's also user friendly for the most part because I'm no techie. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I am neutral due to out-of-box failure
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The battery must be defective because after charging it twice according to directions, the camera lasted for 1-3 shots taken in succession then just turned off.  No real help from original seller, Amazon won't replace, only return this type of item.  Since I purchased it using "points", I assumed a nightmare to execute an exchange so had to return it to Sony for warranty repair/replacement.  Very inconvenient and annoying!!PS  This camera model was recommended to me by a professional photographer.  When the commotion settles, I am looking forward to a better experience.

Reviews.Title: not even 3 months old and button broke!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Book Lover"
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, still works in regular camera/picture taking mode, but the button that switches between panoramic (which I never even tried to use), still and movie no longer works.  What's up with that!!!!!!!!!!!!  Now I have to try to get it fixed, I suppose...  YUCK.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Diane Darby
Reviews.Content: love it so small but incredible powerful, takes awesome clear pics. I use a neck strap and a small case better then all the expensive heavy gear I also have and now never use.

Reviews.Title: Performs just fine, exactly as I thought it would
Reviews.Author: R. Tudor
Reviews.Content: Works just like the reviews said it would. Has a built-in guide, takes good pictures, simple to understand. Wish it had a viewfinder, but cameras in this price range do not have them. Other than that, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: Very nice so far.
Reviews.Author: hamatha
Reviews.Content: Bought for a vacation at the beach and took great pics, but not at first. Too Orange and surreal. Use the Easy mode. In this mode not great in low light but we did not do much at night anyway. Kids loved it. Takes great video too. Feels good in the hand. Decent build quality. No plastic. Only had it for two months will update later. Happy with purchase. Would buy again. Got the package deal with case and sim. Great deal for $100.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my dinky Canon
Reviews.Author: emmy5881
Reviews.Content: I had a point and shoot Canon elf something or other, and this camera is MILES above it. It's quick, the battery life lasts forever, and for a point and shoot it has more options than I could imagine.It takes sharp pictures, and doesn't lag a lot between shots. The flash works well (well enough for a P&S;), and the autofocus is fantastic.I could rave forever about the other features, but honestly, it's just a great little camera, that's mostly intuitive, with tons of features and takes great pictures. If you need something tiny and quick, this is a fantastic bet.

Reviews.Title: Too New
Reviews.Author: D. Thomas
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived few weeks ago but has not been tested enough to rate fairly. The order came quick and I like how it is easy to follow and figure out. Need to use more to really give true rating. Happy so far.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber -shot DSC-WX50
Reviews.Author: Ann Brown
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!!! Very easy to use and the photos turn out really nice! The quality of this camera exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Krishnasamy Nallasivam
Reviews.Content: Good one. But need to go with funky small buttons. But camera and its work are good. Still need to explore more in it

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera.
Reviews.Author: kevin dooley
Reviews.Content: Always able to catch the great shots that are happening around me. Easy to use and lightweight . Convenient to carry all the time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome panoramics
Reviews.Author: SK480
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a camera that does in-camera panoramas so I decided to get this one.  I've been testing it for several weeks now and I am very pleased with the pano shots I have gotten.  It takes a little practice and trial and error, but even in low light it produces gorgeous shots.  I'm not as happy with the quality of the zoomed shots however, they are very grainey and out of focus, which is why it didn't get 5 stars.  But since I got it for the sweep panoramic, at a very good price, I'm quite happy with it so far!  It's got tons of other features as well, which I can't wait to try.  Another bonus is that I had an older model Sony and the battery, charger and memory cards all fit this one! Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Hector Scelza
Reviews.Content: it's a very good camera, with many good features, good lensquality is above expectations for the price, try it

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot
Reviews.Author: Matt Kramerick
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this little powerhouse of a camera!!! I have been looking for a camera that takes great pictures, small enough to pocket if need be and be able to learn how to use with the computer. This one fits just right in what I wanted in a camera. I can do more with the cyber-shot than I expected. Good little camera and for the price.... well that was even better ; )  Ginny K.

Reviews.Title: Great (fairly) easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda Alderfer
Reviews.Content: No complaints- simple but has a lot of great features and takes nice pics/videos (the control to change settings are a little weird, but no big deal)

Reviews.Title: Very Nice camera loaded with feautures BUT....
Reviews.Author: Regis
Reviews.Content: I ordered Black and they gave me silver i know ... its not a big deal but comeon can't you get the color right? aside from that I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: alice a shulman
Reviews.Content: My very old Sony camera was terrific.  This not so much.It works, but the quality of the shots don't compare to my old cybershot.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Victor Niño
Reviews.Content: Good photos, good quality, very easy function, good dimension. The battery is long duration, and cool product. The camera is rapid  and good in the night.

Reviews.Title: Functions Fine
Reviews.Author: Randy Deltuva
Reviews.Content: Functions fine however does not come with the micro USB cord required to hook the camera up to your computer so make sure you purchase that separately (unless you plan on just popping out the memory card and inputting it directly into your computer.)

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Neverenoughshoes
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband who's an electrician. He wanted it to take pictures on job sites when the sheet rockers bury his wires. He finds it useful so he keeps it in his truck. Sorry I can't elaborate on it's specific qualities, but we've owned Sony Cyber-shots in the past and have no complaints.
